projects.text: Lead front end rebuild of ecommerse services website using HTML5 video, ES6 JavaScript, CSS animations, and responsive web design.
projects.title: Ripen

projects.text: This is a clothing website Gary developed for New York City designer Stacy Chang. This uses many high resolution photos, which load efficiently through a combination of responsive design, lazy loading, and other optimization techniques.
projects.title: Shop The Lookbook
Metallica on Spotify
projects.text: Gary worked with the music streaming company Spotify to code a series of promotional pages to exhibit all of Metallica's albums when they were first released for web streaming. These were featured on the Spotify app's home screen.

projects.text: This is an e-commerse website based a template that Gary customized to fit the client's needs.

projects.title: Gary + Dana
projects.text:
A personal website Gary built for his wedding. It was initially used for guest RSVPs and information.

Afterwards, the site was transitioned to share wedding photos, music and video, and later baby photos.

projects.title: iCarly
projects.text:
iCarly.com is the first of a series of websites Gary helped develop for Nickelodeon TV shows produced by Dan Schneider.

Other Nickelodeon show sites Gary worked on extensively Victorious, Sam And Cat, and Game Shakers.

These websites sometimes experienced extreme volumes of traffic corresponding to TV broadcasts. Keeping 100% uptime required careful architectural planning, caching, and utilizing content delivery networks.

Some interesting parts of the Nickelodeon sites that Gary coded are custom video players, music players, an avatar creator, and a variety of kid-friendly animations and widgets.

projects.title: Varsity Tutors
projects.text: Varsity Tutors is an online learning platform and nationwide network of tutors. I worked with a remote team of developers updating their Rails applications including a rebuild of their customer payment page, adding content management features, and writing extensive unit tests.
